column5: http://lifehacker.com/5308039/repel-flies-...-a-bag-of-water  Anyone every try this?  I'm going to give it a shot next time I'm at the cottage. If it works there it'll work anywhere! Hopefully it does cause it would be nice to have fewer mosquitos at the very least while on the BBQ and doing yard work.
The trick isn't just a bag of water, but with one or two things in the bottom of it i.e. two pennies at the bottom of the bag.  And it only works on house flies, mossies don't give a hoot.

I've tried it, it works to some extent.  I don't know about the whole penny in the bottom of the bag thing though......I've never done that and its been succesful.  Didn't do anything for the skeeters though....
Too bad, i was hoping for non-chemical solution to use up north. Oh well. Bring on the house flies then!
Tried one time with a wine party on my deck. All I got was a bunch of laughs from it.......flies were still around.
